column1: From saving lives by stopping COVID-19 to vaccine distribution economic stimulus protecting civil rights and battling climate change — we must deliver for the American people and I’ll fight everyday to do just that.

Our health care system is under immense pressure as COVID cases and hospitalizations continue to rise dramatically. We all have to do our part by masking up & limiting exposure. I’m working to pass a package to beat this virus. We’re all in this together. https://t.co/7Vg6DUXaFV

Texas has passed a grim milestone with 1 million reported COVID cases. Everyone should do their part and wear a mask to stop the spread but we need action. The outgoing Administration can still help us fight this virus and we should pass a package now. https://t.co/eLhxY4lRt2

We can move forward as a nation by working together to solve big problems.  We can lower health care costs and expand coverage to millions in Texas who need it. We can pass COVID relief to get folks help now.  I'll keep fighting for #TX32 to do just that. https://t.co/i6Lr3Rna6q

I’ve been calling repeatedly for a COVID package that will help beat this virus and help North Texans right now.   We need leadership who will make sure we have a COVID response that doesn’t leave anyone behind.  It’s all on the ballot on Nov. 3. https://t.co/dU31FRWylI

There are just two days left to vote early.   Health care is on the ballot. Our COVID response is on the ballot. An economy that works for every North Texan is on the ballot.   So make a plan to vote early at https://t.co/TQhD7kNhH4. https://t.co/lXEZzbW7Ip

While North Texans wait for Senate action on COVID relief it only took 30 days to rush through this nomination.   Now with the fate of the Affordable Care Act at the Supreme Court your health care and so much more is on the ballot.  Vote. https://t.co/ix0zYDWsju

I've worked with both parties to deliver real results for #TX32 like the Garland VA and USMCA trade deal. I've fought to lower prescription drug prices protect your health care and deliver COVID relief.  Our work is not done and I'll keep fighting for North Texans in Congress. https://t.co/yfSriUCZZO

I have been clear since the beginning that we need a national strategy to beat this virus.  I voted twice for bills to bring more COVID relief and ramp up testing and I’ve urged leaders in both parties to get something done.   Action is needed to help North Texans. #TX32

This election is about where we want to go as a nation. It's about a robust response to COVID stopping attacks on our health care and lowering costs and ensuring folks can live their version of the American Dream.  Watch our #TX32 debate tomorrow sponsored by @DRC and @WFAA. https://t.co/NXYlXnjV0H

Texas has shattered voter registration records. Now every Texan must make a plan and vote.  There is so much stake. Your health care. A robust COVID recovery. Access to a good education and a good job. And so much more.  So make a plan to vote today. https://t.co/ZkjWa037Qu

Congress and the Administration should work together and get a COVID relief package passed and help the American people. The House voted twice for relief and I urge the negotiators to stay at the table until we get something done to help North Texans. https://t.co/tmXtVJjuWd

I call on Ms. Collins to take down her ads stating these now-debunked claims so we can engage on the issues important to North Texans like responding to COVID-19 and lowering the cost of health care and prescription drugs.

I will always put North Texas first. Attacks from my opponent misrepresent my record and are completely false.  Unlike my opponent I've proven that I will fight for the COVID relief we need and work to lower health care and prescription drug costs. https://t.co/j2Oai1Hiuw #TX32 https://t.co/ybfXX5RPNh

The choice is clear for #TX32 on health care. I support improving the Affordable Care Act and my opponent has no plan.   I have fought since day one to protect your health care worked to ramp up COVID testing and lower prescription drug and health care costs across the board. https://t.co/EtJvVvWPxL

I’ve voted to pass common-sense bills to help North Texans. From investing in infrastructure to COVID relief to protecting your health care.  The Senate inaction must end and I’ll keep working to deliver results. Thanks Cynthia for your @dallasnews letter: https://t.co/71U708WRfN https://t.co/CYrqbvdtUQ

Early voting has started so we must reach every North Texan in every corner of #TX32 to talk about health care education our economy our response to COVID and so much more.   Join #TeamColin for a phone bank this week. https://t.co/sAblDBAAoU

I joined @DrBiden in Dallas today to talk about why we need every Texan to vote early this election.   Health care the economy education and a COVID recovery that doesn’t leave anyone behind -- it’s all on the ballot.   So make a plan to vote early. https://t.co/l9DKAitScr

No matter who you are or where you live everyone should be able to afford a good education.  I was glad to talk to the student journalists at @SMU's @thedailycampus about making college more affordable and ramping up testing to beat COVID. https://t.co/KIp42PFTcb

There's so much at stake in this election.  From access to affordable health care a COVID recovery that doesn’t leave anyone behind the future of our economy and the civil rights of every American.  This is the most important election of our lifetimes. https://t.co/5BJsJu7p8s

Now more than ever we need the leadership of @JoeBiden & @KamalaHarris which will unite us behind our shared values and make progress on health care COVID and an economy that works for everyone.  Welcome to North Texas @DouglasEmhoff we’re glad you’re here sharing that message. https://t.co/Wtse3QyAw6

From securing the Garland VA to protecting our health care and COVID relief to reining in the influence of special interests -- I’ve been working to deliver results for North Texas.  But there is more work to do and we need your help.  Join us: https://t.co/k3SS6evYMS #TX32 https://t.co/UXHGdC9F9o

We've lost 200000 Americans to COVID-19 -- leaving families loved ones and communities devastated.  It didn't have to be this way.  We need a national strategy to beat this virus and save lives. https://t.co/PgZwzxgkii

The President knew COVID was a deadly threat while he was downplaying it all at an incalculable cost in lives and livelihoods.  This election is a choice between leaders who will tell the truth or those who will stick by this President no matter the cost. https://t.co/D6GM95HFXr

One in four people in Texas lack health care coverage. Many of the most vulnerable folks among us were in a health crisis long before the COVID-19. We need our state leaders to expand Medicaid to ensure that no one goes without care. https://t.co/N60XDadgZ5

The Postal Service is an integral part to keeping our communities running smoothly delivering families' essential supplies and helping small businesses run and is currently hit hard by COVID-19. Congress must act to give USPS the relief it needs. https://t.co/0kz2EmoPnK

COVID-19 has shown us how our health care system fails so many. Texas currently has over 5 million uninsured adults mostly members of diverse communities.  Enough is enough — our state leaders need to expand Medicaid to ensure no one goes without care. https://t.co/XoCI165zf4

It should not be so confusing or costly to get tested for COVID-19. It's unacceptable this Administration still doesn't have a national strategy on testing. I'm working to ensure every North Texan who needs a test can get one. https://t.co/7tsHxlqsdp

We have now lost more than 150000 Americans to COVID-19 and it didn't have to be this way. We need a national strategy to beat this virus including ensuring every American who needs a test can get one expanding contact tracing and listening to experts.https://t.co/kIp8cFSB2t

Tragically Dallas County reported its first pre-teen death today & more children are testing positive for COVID-19. All of us including our kids should wear a mask and follow social distancing guidelines. It will save lives and keep our families safe https://t.co/cA3LDU7zAi

Contracting COVID-19 is especially dangerous for our veterans who were exposed to air hazards while serving abroad.  No one should fear for their health just to cast their ballot. We should expand vote-by-mail to our veterans and every eligible Texan. https://t.co/lzn6WPCYTq

The safety of our kids should always come first. Mounting evidence shows that COVID-19 can be a serious illness for kids. As we discuss how to get back to school we have to listen to the experts to ensure that we keep our kids are safe.   https://t.co/NDAfkw1YAm

Local government budgets cover everything from public education to infrastructure. The economic downturn caused by COVID-19 is impacting every community. I'll continue to fight for federal aid so our local governments can keep providing essential services. https://t.co/mBlRqtqGsT

Take a moment to read @JasonVillalba’s story about losing his grandfather to COVID-19.  Thank you Jason for sharing your family’s story & shining a light on the need to understand why Latinos are being hit so hard & what needs to be done to stop it. https://t.co/5Fn0VP6Ft4

It's clear we need real leadership on health care. In the midst of COVID-19 three out of 10 Texans are uninsured. Since day one in Congress I have fought against attacks on our health care and I will continue to fight for affordable care for everyone. https://t.co/8X9VYhajXn

Public health should be guided by experts and they're again saying we need a national plan to fight COVID-19. I voted for the Heroes Act to help do just that and I urge the Senate to take up this legislation now so we can move forward. https://t.co/d1BuIggfoN

Heartbreaking news. Aly and I send our deepest condolences to Julian Joaquin and the entire Castro family for the loss of their stepmother Alice.  We're all praying for their father Jesse to have a full recovery as he continues to fight COVID-19. https://t.co/D5S548S6im

The safety of child care centers is paramount for our kids parents and essential workers. Since mid-May COVID-19 cases in child care centers have gone up from 59 to 576. This is a priority and we must ensure CDC guidelines are followed with transparency https://t.co/Z4a3rwxdxp

In the past 5 days Dallas has seen over 1000 new COVID-19 cases daily. We all need to do our part to save lives by listening to experts like Dr. Birx by staying home as much as possible and always wearing a mask. We can get through this together https://t.co/HRZOGyesZz

America is at its best when we lead the global stage and convene nations around shared values — not retreat from it.   The WHO is critical to combating COVID-19 around the world and withdrawing will only strengthen China’s already growing influence. https://t.co/04dULFVZjp

It’s been over 50 days since the House passed the Heroes Act to fight COVID-19 and support our state and local governments.   The Senate should pass this bill before cities and states are forced to make deep cuts to essential services and education. https://t.co/BZEDcSRH3B

Texas is experiencing exponential uncontrolled growth in COVID-19 cases and we need our leaders at every level to heed the advice of public health experts — not dismiss it. Listening to experts like Dr. Fauci can help stop the spread and save lives. https://t.co/TwPtDnLIQV
Today Dallas County will report 601 new cases of COVID-19 as well as 20 deaths - a tragic result of our economy reopening way too soon.  Watch my interview with @TheLastWord. https://t.co/htrm51tjnd

I welcome the Vice President coming to Dallas to meet w/ our local health officials about the COVID crisis gripping our area.   But I wish he’d done so without endangering North Texans and the frontline health care workers trying to save lives. #WearAMask https://t.co/fBKQU9WhSO

As we see record COVID-19 case numbers and read about hospital & ICU capacity we can’t ever forget the lives being lost changed and risked on the frontlines.  Take a moment to see what the battle against COVID looks like at Parkland and remember we’re in this fight together. https://t.co/4BbDwIAxd0

The spread of #COVID19 has made one thing clear — we must tackle this together. Thank you @Network_Impacts for helping thousands of families in Richardson put food on the table during this crisis and showing up for our community.  https://t.co/Pzi2MKXnQg

Every eligible Texan should be able to vote safely during this pandemic. Governor Abbott has rightly encouraged Texans to stay home to stop the spread of coronavirus he should allow everyone to vote from home as well. https://t.co/193SCBYF92

We’re seeing record highs for COVID-19 in North TX. We know what works: wearing a mask social distancing & staying at home. We all need to do what we can to save lives & honor our frontline workers who are making incredible sacrifices for our community https://t.co/058w3FQlHy

To beat COVID-19 we have to be honest about the challenges we face and listen to the experts. North Texas is experiencing record hospitalizations and new cases.  What we need is local flexibility to protect our citizens and straight talk from our leaders. https://t.co/UpPHbHh1Q8

145000 students in @dallasschools are food insecure and we’ve seen that number go up since the closing of schools due to COVID-19. Thank you to @HungerBustersTX for all that you do to ensure that no child goes hungry. https://t.co/bgaWav4jAH

The only way to combat this public health crisis is together. On June 16th and 23rd Hamilton Park Methodist Church will host free community COVID-19 testing but they need our help to test everyone who needs it. If you can volunteer reach out to Scott at (214) 356-7975 https://t.co/6U5Iom1idx

North Texas is at the highest point of #COVID19 hospitalizations that we’ve seen. Everyone needs to continue to do their part to flatten the curve including social distancing and wearing a mask. Together we can save lives and beat this but only if we keep our eye on the ball https://t.co/vjO426AKD1

Latinos in North Texas are on the frontlines to fight #COVID19 yet they're disproportionately at risk of getting sick & are losing their jobs & health care. We must do all we can so every North Texan can get the resources they need to weather this crisis https://t.co/kQqIs89xsr

COVID-19 and the unjust murder of George Floyd have held up a mirror to our society making clear how our system fails so many. We have a lot of work to do to address these problems and heal our divisions. https://t.co/Q8glQeIlGN

As President Trump visits Dallas today we face record-high #COVID19 cases. Experts predicted this and yet we still have not ramped up testing tracing and treatment to the levels we need to reopen safely.  We can get this done if we work together but we need leadership.

In Dallas before COVID-19 the black community has already experienced so much pain stemming from the killings of Jordan Edwards Sandra Bland Botham Jean and Atatiana Jefferson. https://t.co/H1PnFKxxTg

COVID-19 has held up a mirror to our society laying bare our deep inequities.  For black Americans the disproportionate impact of this virus has been paired with the reminder of the original and constant threat of racist violence playing in loops on our screens and televisions.

100000 Americans have died from COVID-19 the highest death toll in the world. The choice before us is clear: we can continue down the path we are on or we can choose to take a different one guided by science and the best ideas from around the world. https://t.co/I1FFHy81oF

We must shift our thinking and go on offense against this pandemic to beat #COVID19. I'm working to pass a plan that will dramatically ramp up testing tracing and treatment so North Texas can safely move forward.   Read my Q&A with @DMagazine: https://t.co/O8UkVa602g

The impacts of this reopening will not be felt equally. Hourly workers will be forced to choose between their jobs and their health. These workers are disproportionately women and people of color who are also more likely to suffer from conditions that make COVID-19 more lethal.

Without any flexibility for cities like Dallas that are experiencing severe outbreaks the Governor has moved ahead with reopening salons and gyms against the advice of medical experts like Dr. Birx from the White House’s Coronavirus Task Force. https://t.co/WiYtuaFaAX

Thanks to the hard work of the @VANorthTexas the new Garland VA will soon increase its capacity to 207 beds for COVID-19 patients. I’m proud to have led this effort and can’t thank the people at the North Texas VA the City of Garland and @bswhealth enough for making this happen. https://t.co/g2uitCkdm5

Dolores is leading Dallas County’s coronavirus drive-through testing at Parkland and is on the frontlines every day in service to our community. Thank you Dolores for you and your team’s hard work for North Texas https://t.co/mDM3iobBXB

I am proud to have led the effort with the North Texas community to make the Garland VA Medical Center a reality serving veteran #COVID19 patients now and 184000 of our veterans across North Texas for years to come. https://t.co/OCQ9KPpSyg

To ensure kids at @dallasschools can stay healthy and learn during this crisis it will take all of us. I'm taking part in the #COVIDCantStopMe #COVIDCantStopUs campaign to support @FutureofDallas.  Text DallasISD to 91999 to donate.  @MiguelForDallas I’m tagging you! cc: @mphav https://t.co/JPhLwElY0c

Thank you to @KraftHeinzCo for your leadership and helping our students during #COVID19. @dallasschools and I are grateful for your contribution and continued support for the North Texas community. https://t.co/Jscz8Lkkra

The Comfort Food Care Packages Program will help combat food insecurity during #COVID19 and supply food for youth and families across Texas. If you are a restaurant owner or looking for ways to help your community you can learn more here: https://t.co/FbJ7EEqnxv https://t.co/8hTBZz64vB

Complete data is crucial in identifying and addressing racial inequities in our health care system. As we fight this disease let’s ensure that everyone no matter who they are gets equal access to care they need. #COVID19. https://t.co/mRenh0l5K2

The Texas health system has deep inequities which hurt African-American and Latino communities. Folks that were disproportionately harmed by Texas not expanding Medicaid are also more likely to be at risk of #COVID19.   We must do better for ALL Texans. https://t.co/DluuJtvI2F

Sad news for everyone at @dallasnews and I know many in North Texas are facing similar circumstances.   I applaud their commitment to making health stories on #COVID19 available for free. Thoughtful informative reporting is so important especially now. https://t.co/cnkkY7rL7Q
Securing this hospital is a win for everyone involved. It will help us fight #COVID19 now and will go on to serve 184000 veterans create 5000 jobs and save taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars.

I will always believe in North Texas and our ability to do big things. Today we announced an agreement to bring a new VA hospital to Garland.  It will first help the VA fight #COVID19 and eventually serve 184000 veterans and create thousands of jobs. https://t.co/LCOlus5as6

Many North Texans have lost their jobs due to #COVID19 and even though this is a difficult time there are resources to help. If you need a job please review these resources and job opportunities for displaced workers from @sayyestodallas and the @DRC: https://t.co/aRWPHY9ljV

Tomorrow @ntfb is distributing over 4000 free meals boxes in Fair Park from 9am-1pm to help those who are facing food insecurity during #COVID19.  This is what North Texans showing up for each other looks like thank you to all volunteers & orgs involved https://t.co/l7fixk9s3x

It will take every part of our government to fight COVID-19. In a national crisis the VA has a vital role to play in supporting our public health system.   As a member of the VA Committee I spoke to the @dallasnews about our work to support that mission. https://t.co/dohUUJwmWu

Coaches don’t just prepare athletes to compete they prepare them for life. All of N Texas will feel the loss of Coach McDaniel to COVID-19 but my heart goes out especially to the young women he coached to greatness. Thank you for the lives you touched.   https://t.co/1hSm8FUr3W

To combat #COVID19 keep our families safe and reopen our economy we need to use every resource we have. That's why I've repeatedly urged the President to invoke the Defense Production Act. It's time we put everything we've got to fight this and support our first responders. https://t.co/P3GEebFtrG

The only way we will overcome #COVID19 is by working together. Today we passed relief to help North Texas families the unemployed small businesses and our workers. We have more work to do and I'll keep fighting to get North Texas the resources we need. https://t.co/29emkcai0L

Yesterday I talked to @WFAA and took questions on how how we are going to combat #COVID19 together. From Stay Home Stay Safe measures to supporting small businesses — I'm fighting to keep our families healthy and bring local economic relief. Watch here: https://t.co/KGKrvZZ02F

Our health care workers need the necessary equipment to protect themselves and fight the spread of #COVID19. There is bipartisan agreement and lives are at stake. I've called on the President to use the Defense Production Act. He should do it immediately. https://t.co/q6tf5mV3ew

We now have over 40000 confirmed #Covid19 cases and over 500 deaths in the US. Yesterday was the first day 100 people died due to the virus in a single day. At the current rate of transmission these numbers will skyrocket unless we all act now. #StayHome https://t.co/BkFID5kluj

Take a few minutes out of your day to watch this incredibly informative video about the exponential growth of pandemic viruses and why we must take strong action now. #COVIDー19 https://t.co/tD3HanG4u9

Our health care workers are on the frontlines of this war against #coronavirus. It is critical that they have what they need to protect themselves and that’s why I’ve called on President Trump to utilize the Defense Production Act. https://t.co/FbWloSxEzu

There are resources available for North Texans if your job has been affected by #COVID19. You can apply for benefits online or by calling @TXWorkforce. They have waived the 10-day waiting period and work search requirements. https://t.co/gePRcmPOsc

Fighting the coronavirus is going to take all of us & now more than ever we're realizing how interconnected we are. But while we're keeping our community healthy we have to ensure we also protect the small businesses that are the backbone of our economy. https://t.co/1jtLPNJwe9

North Texas is at its best when we come together to help our neighbors. As we take measures to stop the spread of #COVID_19 this creates uncertainty for many. If you are able pitch in to help these orgs that will be so valuable to many North Texans. https://t.co/FfzdRA1HxW

I know this is a difficult and scary time for many North Texans but these new measures will help us combat and contain #coronavirus. If we follow these measures and other best practices and we all do our part we will get through this faster and safer. https://t.co/FL6IItd2B3

This is good news for North Texans but we have a lot more work to do. We all have a part to play in combating the spread of #COVID19. Telework if you can avoid crowds wash your hands + stay home if you're sick & contact your health care professional. https://t.co/4NVffGnXWe

Now is the time we must come together and ensure that those who need access to free #coronavirus testing paid leave and other assistance can get it.   We all have a role to play to stay healthy and this will help provide relief to North Texans impacted. https://t.co/8zBN3MSgXZ

Thank you @mcuban for your leadership and empathy in taking care of the workers who will be impacted in Dallas by the suspension of the NBA season. It’s going to take all of us working together to make it through the #Covid_19 crisis and Dallas is lucky to have leaders like you. https://t.co/g8dF5Cvtmk

We all have a role in stopping the spread of #COVID19. Though tough times are ahead I know we can come together to address this crisis.   As Congress considers relief for workers and communities please take precautions like washing your hands and staying home if you feel sick.

The #coronavirus crisis highlights why paid family and sick leave policies are so critical. If workers or someone they care for are sick — they should be able to stay home.   They will be more productive and we’ll all be safer. https://t.co/UmPk5JunNj

North Texans come together in times of uncertainty b/c the health and well being of our community is critical. That’s why I led a #coronavirus town hall with local health experts so you can get correct info & updates on how we’re combatting this disease. https://t.co/oYnsA11ZIY
